Posted By: SocialExperiment (7/16/2009 11:51:32 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This is Time Walk for 3 more mana. This card just shows how heavily overpowered Blue is. Black is my favorite color, and it is the most underpowered color this go around. Red has Lightning Bolt & cards like Swerve or Shunt (counters w/twist), White has Path to Exile, Baneslayer, etc, Green has elves/faeries which has always been a tournament staple, as well as its intense synergy with White now, and Blue... is something every player has to play now. Doom Blade isn't that good as you can regen the creature, Lilliana Vess is not the best planeswalker by far... I could go on. For 5 mana, black gets Rise From The Grave. Wtf?
posts.html:

posts.post_content: The fact that it's targeted makes it vulnerable to things like [Shunt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shunt), [Swerve](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swerve), and [Wild Ricochet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Ricochet). If your opponent is packing any of those when you cast this, he could potentially steal your extra turn.

posts.post_content: In answer to the issue of why black can't have something like this, taking extra turns is an ability that falls into blue's section of the color pie. Time magic in general isn't something that black specializes in, and so black doesn't need cards like this. And as far as the accusations of blue being overpowered, have you even seen [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel)? Or [Jump](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jump), for that matter? Get your head on straight. I agree that black is also lacking, but to call blue number one this time around is absurd.
posts.html:
